subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Another voice--native american?
author: regan pederson
full_text:
--0-1416488247-1190924696=:56714
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

It would be intriguing and awesome to witness someone in their native tongue having a discussion with them. One of my major interests are evps in other languages. Say in Thailand, do they come across in Thai, or in English?

Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:          Apparently not, since presumably they know who they are talking to. 

    
---------------------------------
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
From: turningpink@...
Date: Thu, 27 Sep 2007 12:01:54 -0700
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Another voice--native american?

        Frank,
  When native americans come across, or when people of other ethnic regions come across, do they speak in their native tongue?

Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
      This is from 24, but I used a different deck that resulted in weak, and noisy recoridng. That's the first time for this "Blackfoot". I think they are talking about Whitley Strieber. I'd send it to him, but there's about zero chance of it being recieved, or listend to, as most of these people tend "know better". 
 
 Frank-S
